attributes.action: stop Redbridge Council denying children foster placements because the foster carer is a smoker
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Central government has a duty under The Children’s Act 2004 and the Every Child Matters Framework to work toward 5 outcomes for Children i.e Be healthy, Stay safe, Enjoy and achieve, Make a positive contribution and Achieve economic wellbeing

All the available information and research shows that outcomes for children in council care homes are significantly worse than for children in a family care setting. Redbridge Council's decision denies children opportunities for a better future due to its focus on a single health issue to the exclusion of other factors.

The danger of passive smoking can easily be dealt with through the imposing of conditions.
